lines.text: What happened to my car?
Brad probably loaned the car to the Pope. Don't let the hat fool you, Man, the Pope's a crazy fucker. He probably blessed the car, got wasted and drove it off a fucking cliff.
Well choke my chicken! Your name's Pear right? You lived next door to Frank, am I right?
Yeah.
Small world ain't it?
Too small.
Frank says you're a real asshole and if you fuck with me, I'll kill you, you understand?
I'm not moving to Idaho. No fucking way.
Hey! That's a quarter in the swear jar, young lady.

[Begins putting money into the swear jar as she speaks]
Okay, there's no God damn way I'm God damn moving to Ida-son of a bitch, shit eating-ho.
You may want to decorate this house differently.

[Looking at a nude statue]
Oh yes, we'd get bigger penises.
Mr. Pear?
Yes.
How's it hanging?
How's what hanging?
Your dick.
It's hanging to the left.
Everything is OK. Your application is fine. But right now, I can't give you any money.
When *can* you give us the money?
Mr. Pear, are you a gambling man?
No, I'm not!
Well, you are now. Look, I'm gonna level with you people. I just bet a big chunk of the bank's money on Hannah Blue in the 7th at Hallmark Downs.
That's embezzlement!
That's right. And that's exactly what I've been doing here for 22 years. But I'll tell ya, this horse can't lose. You'll get your money for the house. This horse has never lost on a wet track.
[over radio]
I can't *remember* when I've ever seen a track this *dry*.
I gave him the wrong goddamn finger!
Honey, our daughter's getting married, you wanna come?
I don't want your money, I want those assholes!
Oh *those* assholes!
What the fuck are you doing?
I want you to take this big red motherfucker and put it back in your garage, you understand you son of a bitch? And go to the store and get a human sized mower!
Casey, where did you find this man? Is there an asshole convention in town?
Frank, remember two years I loaned you my weed whacker? Well since we're moving, I've come to ask for it back.
No.
It's *our* weed whacker, Frank, the whole family went down to Sears together. So I've come to ask you to give it back.
No.

Frank, I loaned it to you two years ago to cut yor weeds. You haven't cut shit with the weed whacker! What did you do with it? Keep the weed whacker, Frank! Be happy with it because you have to friends! Nobody wants to talk to you!
Frank, that you?
Edwards, Perry! Well choke my chicken!
Maybe we'll send you a plane ticket and you can visit us at Christmas.
Good but I won't.
Now that your job's been eliminated, sir, what are your future plans?
I just sharpened my pencil!
Excuse me, does your dog bite?
Ma'am, that dog hasn't farted since March '78.
[Rudy wants to marry Casey]
Sure, we'll have our problems, just like most young couples.
You're gonna have a problem walking straight if you don't take your hands off my daughter.

[on top of Edwards and Perry's moving truck]
Now look here, Mr. Pear, if you got any complaints about our service, you better call the head office.
Shut the hell up. No more talk. I want my furniture!
Who you think you talkin' to? I'll stomp a mudhole in your ass, poop butt!
[Arlo kicks him in the head]
The kitchen. Where is the kitchen? They took the god damn kitchen!
I'm calling about the Ginsu knives. Arlo Pear. P-E-A-R.
So, you found your dream house. And right now you're asking First Boise Savings & Loan to give you a mortgage.
As you can see, I've had the same job for 15 years.
Well, that's very nice, but it's not enough. I mean, Al Capone had the same job for 30 years.
But we've never had any problem with credit.
Oh, don't get me wrong. I trust you. We trust all our customers. Why, this bank was *built* on trust. Here. Sign here.
Uh, you gotta get closer. This pen is chained down, you know.

[arrives at the new house on top of a semi trailer]
Honey! Look what I found! I found our shit... I brought our shit home... this is our shit!

[Frank has taken a bite out of an unpeeled banana]
Aren't you gonna peel that?
I know what's in it.

[after the altercation with the movers at their new home, a now polite Gorgo speaks for the first time... he's holding a chair]
Excuse me Mrs. Pear, where would you like this?
Over by the door, thanks.

[smiles pleasantly]
I think that's the perfect place for it, if you don't mind my saying so.
